floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
Flooding is possible as the river, and its streams are rising, due to prolonged, heavy rain. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible.
Areas most at risk include tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch but a particular focus is in the smaller tributaries in the Moyles Court area.
Further rainfall is forecast today which may raise levels further.
We are closely monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Consider activating any property flood protection products.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible Friday evening 6th September and into Saturday 7th September.
River levels remain high and further heavy rain is expected during the afternoon of Friday 6th September in the River Clyst and Culm and their tributaries area. 
There may be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers.
We expect the rivers to remain high throughout the evening of Friday 6th September and Saturday 7th September, though no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are continue to monitoring river levels, and this message will be updated on Saturday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes

items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. There may be standing water seen for several days. Further heavy rainfall is expected over the weekend and Flood Alerts may be issued.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Axe has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. There may be standing water seen for several days. Further heavy rainfall is expected over the weekend. Flood Alerts may be issued.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Cox's Flume river gauge as a result of predicted heavy rainfall later this evening. Consequently, flooding may occur later this evening and overnight, but there is currently low confidence given the unpredictable nature of the forecast rainfall. Flooding could affect low lying land and roads adjacent to Wymans Brook, Carrant Brook, Hatherley Brook, Swilgate and the River Chelt. Locations that may be affected include Mitton, Ashchurch, Walton Cardiff, and locations along the River Chelt from Charlton Kings to Uckington and Boddington.

River levels could remain high until Saturday morning, 07/09/2024. We are closely monitoring the situation.

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00am on Saturday, 07/09/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Scrase Bridge Stream, West Common Stream

items.message:
The Scrasebridge and West Common Streams have returned nearer to normal following intense rainfall on Thursday and Friday morning. Lighter showers are expected on Friday evening and into Saturday. River levels are not expected to rise significantly in response to this. Therefore, this flood alert will be removed. Heavier showers could occur on Sunday. We'll reissue this message if property flooding again becomes possible. 

If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river on Bridge Road or Hickmans Lane, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We routinely clear debris from grilles through Lindfield, including the Builders Centre and Witch Inn, to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk.
